task: How to Make Low Carb Chicken Soup
step: Put the chicken in the pot.
Place the pot on the stove over medium heat.
Add the spices.
Bring the soon-to-be stock to a boil.
Remove from heat and lift chicken out with a couple of large spoons or forks into a large bowl.
Remove the sachet or strain the broth into another pot to remove the cloves, peppercorns, and other annoyances.
Skim the fat.
Put the broth pot back on the stove on low heat.
Add all the vegetables, except red peppers (add those in the last 15 minutes).
Add salt, paprika, and lemon juice.
Add chicken meat.
Simmer for another 30-45 minutes.
Garnish and serve.Remove from heat and serve with green onion slices (small rings) on top.

task: How to Cook Turtle
step: Bring 1.5 pounds (24 oz) of meat and 4.5 cups (1.1 l) of water to a boil.
Add 1 onion, 1 bay leaf, cayenne pepper and salt to the saucepan for flavor.
Cover the saucepan and let the mixture simmer for 2 hours.
Remove the meat and strain the broth.
Melt 5 tablespoons (2.5  fl oz) of butter in the large saucepan.
Add 1 diced onion and 0.33 cups (78 ml) of flour to the melted butter.
Pour in the turtle broth and whisk the soup until it thickens.
Add 5 tablespoons (74 ml) each of tomato puree and Worcestershire sauce.
Chop up your turtle meat and add it to the soup.
Add 0.33 cups (78 ml) of broth and 0.25 cups (59 ml) of lemon juice.
Store turtle soup in the freezer for up to a month or refrigerate it for 3 days.

task: How to Make Vegan Vegetable Soup
step: Combine all the broth ingredients in a large soup pot and stir them until they are well combined.
Bring the ingredients to a low boil.
Add the carrots, celery, cabbage and potatoes and simmer the soup for 20 to 30 minutes or until the potatoes are soft.
Add the cauliflower and broccoli to the mix and cook them for an addition 5 to 10 minutes or until the vegetables are soft when pierced with a fork.
Add the greens and the parsley and cook them until they are just wilted but still bright green.
Discard the bay leaves.
Ladle the soup into bowls.
Top them with a drizzle of flax oil and a sprinkle of sesame seeds.
Finished.

task: How to Make Jalapeno Soup
step: Add 3 tablespoons of olive oil or half a teaspoon of ghee to a Cooking pan and let it heat for about 2 minutes on Medium flame.
Add chopped red onions to the oil and let the onions cook until they become translucent.
Add chopped green bell peppers to the pan and stir it for a minute until the peppers become semi-soft.
Add diced tomatoes or V8 to the mixture.
Chop the jalapeos and add them along with the Cilantro stems to the pan.
Add 1/3 tsp of cumin powder to the mixture and stir it all well for about 30 seconds.
Transfer the contents of the pan to a blender and add 1/4 cup of water or vegetable stock/broth to mix it all well.
Once the contents blend well into a paste, transfer the mixture onto another cooking pan.
Add 1 cup of water/vegetable stock to the mixture and let it come to a boil (This might take a couple of minutes for the all the flavors and stock to cook all the way through).
Add salt to taste.
Add 3 tablespoons of sour cream (light) to get a creamy texture.
Add a little whipping cream to get a rich flavor.
Add just 1/3 tsp of lemon/lime juice on the top.
Keep stirring it till the mixture comes to a boil.
Add garlic croutons and your hot jalapeo soup is ready to serve!.

step: Bring two boxes of chicken stock to a boil in a large pot.
Gather and prepare your vegetables.
Rinse and clean two medium size chicken breasts.
Cut chicken in to bite size pieces, lightly salt and pepper, and boil in the stock till no longer pink in the middle and cooked through.
Once the chicken is cooked through add all your vegetables to the pot and cook until crisp tender.
In a separate pot, cook your egg noodles, following the instructions, until al dente.
Drop temperature to a simmer for about 5 minutes adding salt, pepper, and garlic powder to taste.
Finished.

Pour the ramen and meatballs into your bowl.
Let cool and eat.

task: How to Make Traditional Albanian Leek Soup

Chop a very small amount of celery, and add to the saucepan to add a slightly different texture and flavour.
Add 1 tsp tomato puree to the soup mixture.
Mince 1 clove of garlic and mix with the soup.
Chop the stalk end off of two red bird's eye chilis.
Add the juice of half of a medium sized lemon and season with your choice of herbs, salt and pepper.
Finished.

task: How to Make Turkish Tomato Soup
step: Slice the tomatoes and chop the parsley into very small pieces.
Chop the onion into small pieces and saut on medium high heat with butter in a pan until they are brown/yellow.
Add all the ingredients of step one to the fried onion.
Mix thoroughly and fry for approximately fifteen minutes on half heat, until tomatoes are soft.
While you wait for the tomatoes to soften, heat up three cups of chicken broth/stock.
When the tomato mixture is soft, add the chicken broth/stock and stir well.
Put the lid on the pan and cook the mixture of tomatoes and chicken broth for about ten minutes.
Take the pan off the heat, discard the bay leaf, and use an immersion blender to puree the soup until there are no chunks of tomato left.
Melt a tablespoon of butter in a big pan.
Add teaspoon of flour and stir it well to make a roux - this will melt in the soup and thicken it.
Slowly pour the soup into the pan with the butter and flour.
Add the whipping cream.
Heat the soup on the stove and serve.

task: How to Make Soup Udon at Your House
step: Buy a packet of fresh or frozen udon.

Your udon is ready.

task: How to Make Stocks for Soups and Sauces
step: For chicken stock, heat a little oil or butter over medium heat and add the carcass.
Add the vegetables and bouquet garni and add water to the pan until the ingredients are covered (approx 4 cups or 1 litre of water).
Strain the stock through a fine sieve or cheesecloth and it is ready for use.
For a rich brown beef stock, mix the bones and meat with a little melted butter in a roasting pan.
Tip the bones and meat trimmings into a stock pot and deglaze the roasting pan with a cup of water.
Add the vegetables and bouquet garni and simmer very gently for 30 minutes to 1 hour, then strain and use as required.
For light beef stock, follow the same procedure as for brown beef stock.
For vegetable stock, add a little oil into the stock pot and saut the vegetables gently for a light stock.
In a stock pan, add a little oil and add the fish scraps.

task: How to Make Shrimp Soup

Add the coconut milk, carrots, and 3 cups of water to the saucepan.

Bring the ingredients in the saucepan to a boil.
Add the shrimp to the pot.
Remove the pot from heat.

task: How to Make Roasted Aubergine Soup
step: Cube aubergines and place in a large bowl of salted ice water.
Preheat oven to 450 F (232 C).
Lay cubed aubergines on an aluminium-foil lined baking sheet.
Place sheet in heated oven; bake for 35 minutes until cubes are soft and gooey.
Place a large soup pot over medium-high heat.
Add in the diced onion, garlic cloves, as well as a pinch of sea salt.
Pour in the cans of tomatoes, baked aubergine cubes, potato cubes, and vegetable stock over the caramelized garlic and onion.
Lower heat to medium.
Remove pot from heat at the 45 minute mark.
Emulsify/pure soup to a thick consistency, using a hand blender.
Garnish with peppermint leaves and grated Parmigiano-Reggiano.
Finished.

task: How to Make Weight Watchers Cabbage Soup
step: In a small saucepan, bring 3/4 cup water to a boil; add rice.
In a big saucepan or Dutch oven, heat oil; add garlic.
Stir in carrot and bell pepper; cook, stirring oftentimes, 5 min, until peppers are softened.
Add cabbage and sugar; cook, stirring frequently, four minutes, until cabbage is softened.
Add tomatoes, beans, salt and 2 1/2 cups water to vegetable mixture; bring liquid to a boil.
Stir in dill and vinegar.
Divide cabbage mixture among  soup bowls; top each portion with 1 1/2 teaspoons sour cream.
Finished.

step: Saut the onions in the olive oil.
Add the carrots to the saucepan.
Cover and cook on medium for 10 minutes, adding a little water if necessary.
Add the rice and water/stock to the vegetables.
Whizz with a hand blender or in a food processor.
Divide among serving bowls and top with herbs.

task: How to Make Chinese Chicken Corn Soup
step: Bring the chicken stock to a boil.
Add the can of corn niblets and stir.
Wait until the water boils again.
Beat the eggs.
Add the cubed chicken.
When the water boils again, add the beaten egg slowly, while stirring.
Add the sesame oil, pepper, and salt to taste.
Finished.

task: How to Make Okro Soup
step: Dice 1 onion, 1 bell pepper, and 2 hot peppers.
Pour the palm oil into a pot and turn the burner to medium.
Stir in the crayfish, onion, and peppers.
Add the cooked meat, fish, and stock.
Cover and simmer the soup over medium heat for 10 minutes.
Stir in the chopped okro and cook the soup for 2 minutes.
Mix in chopped greens and cook the soup for 3 minutes.
Taste and serve the okro soup.

task: How to Make Easy Egg Drop Soup
step: Pour chicken broth into a stove-pot, and set the stove on high.
Whisk the egg in a separate bowl.
When the chicken broth is boiling, swirl the soup rapidly, and dribble the egg into it.
Cook until the egg is firm.
Finished.

task: How to Make Chicken Noodle Soup
step: Roughly chop celery, carrots, and an onion.
Combine olive oil, salt, pepper, garlic powder, and Italian seasoning to create a rub.
Add the chicken thighs to the rub and make sure the chicken is fully coated.
Fill the slow cooker with warm water and add in the chicken bouillon paste, stirring until the bullion is fully dissolved.
Add the chopped celery, carrots, and onions to the slow cooker.
Add the chicken thigh to the slow cooker.
Add a bay leaf to the slow cooker.
Cook on high for 6 hours, or on low for 8 hours.
When the time has passed, add in the egg noodles and wait for about 5-8 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Season with salt and pepper to taste and enjoy!.

task: How to Make Cream of Chicken Soup With No Vegetables
step: Melt butter in a large saucepan.
Whisk flour into melted butter.
Cook mixture until smooth but not browned.
Add milk, half-and-half and chicken broth.
Whisk mixture until blended.
Cook mixture until slightly thickened.
Reduce heat.
Add cooked chicken.
Add dash of pepper to taste, white pepper preferred.
Heat until almost steaming.
Serves 4.

task: How to Make Banana Soup
step: Let the butter melt in a pan, but don't allow the butter to color.
Add the flour and stir smoothly.
Add the peeled tomatoes and the peeled bananas in slices with the roux.
Add 2 liters (0.5 US gal)(~2 quarts) of water.
Close the pan of and let the soup cook softly for about 10 minutes.
Add the beef bouillon and season it.
Mix the soup.
Add before serving the soup the cream and chopped parsley.
Finished.

task: How to Make a Quick and Easy French Onion Soup
step: Preheat the oven to about 290C (550F).
Melt the butter in a 1.8 liter (0.5 US gal) or 2 quart pot.
Add the onions and saut until they are tender.
Place the bread on a cookie sheet.
Toast the bread in the oven until the cheese is melted and the edges are golden (about 3 minutes).
Pour the soup into 4 bowls.
Finish off by sprinkling with Parmesan cheese.
Finished.

Fry the onion, garlic, sage, salt and pepper.

Reduce the heat, cover and simmer until the sweet potatoes become tender.
Add the kale.

task: How to Make Vegetarian Minestrone Soup
step: Heat olive oil in a 3-quart stockpot on medium low.
Add garlic and bay leaf.
Add onions, celery and carrots and saut until onions become  translucent.
Stir in spinach.
Add tomatoes and stir.
Add vegetable broth and stir.
Add potatoes, zucchini and peas, mix well.
Add Romano cheese; this will thicken the broth as it simmers.
Lower the heat and simmer until potatoes are softabout 3040 minutes.
Remove bay leaf and garlic.
Serve and enjoy!.
Finished.
